Articles.Content:
<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EYemMG0fwB0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/gsAE0)

When I saw gst\_flyer's tail engines, I knew what I had to built ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)  
  
Key Bindings:  
[1] Toggle Left side engines  
[2] Toggle Right side engines  
[3] Toggle Inboard Flaps  
[4] Toggle Outboard Flaps  
[5] Toggle Landing Lights  
  
Download: [http://www./download/i7q27kw8m8yl86o/MD-11_by_Jetenginestar.craft](http://www./download/i7q27kw8m8yl86o/MD-11_by_Jetenginestar.craft)  

**Engine Startup Proceure**  
1) 

> 
> with SAS desactivated, trim the roll of the whole aircraft to the right (alt + E by default) - (a roll trim between 50% and 100% is easier to see the spinning effect - more and the effect is harder to see ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

2) Press space, this decouples the fan blades and starts the engines  
  
**Note: remember to press Alt-X to reset the aircraft trim before takeoff**  
  
Have Fun ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)  

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QUObwbiUXR0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-31T12:51:30Z" title="05/31/2015 12:51  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 31, 2015</time> by Jetenginestar**

Very pleased by the design of this Mk3 passenger plane, it beats the others so well in terms of form and function ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

A good use of sgt\_flyer's tail engines ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

A nice plane , congratz !
Don't forget to tell how to start-up those engines fans ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> nice plane! how many parts?

Thank You, it has 202 parts

> 
> Don't forget to tell how to start-up those engines fans ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Ops, Thanks for the reminder ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

This is just.. awesome. Beats mine totally. Repped!

What mods did you use for the pictures? The airport and sky seems.. different-looking.

> 
> This is just.. awesome. Beats mine totally. Repped!
> What mods did you use for the pictures? The airport and sky seems.. different-looking.

Airport is from Kerbin City: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46643-Kerbin-City](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46643-Kerbin-City)

Atmospheric Scattering Mod here: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-mod)

> 
> Airport is from Kerbin City: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46643-Kerbin-City](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46643-Kerbin-City)
> Atmospheric Scattering Mod here: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115408-WIP-Scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-mod)

Okay, thanks!

How did you get Kerbin City to work in 1.0.2, and how did you get there, though? It looks really nice with the aircraft.

> 
> Okay, thanks!
> How did you get Kerbin City to work in 1.0.2, and how did you get there, though? It looks really nice with the aircraft.

You'll need Kerbal Konstructs to run it: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105247-0-90-Kerbal-Konstructs-%28v0-7-1%29-Fuel-Mah-Spaceplane](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105247-0-90-Kerbal-Konstructs-%28v0-7-1%29-Fuel-Mah-Spaceplane)!

After that you can choose to launch directly to Kerbin International inside the SPH.

The plane is capable of landing on a carrier when close to empty weight ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QUObwbiUXR0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Hi Jetenginestar - I'm very, very sorry for necroing this thread, but I'm a bit curious; How did you design the wings to be that long and thick?

Thanks! It's glamorous ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

If you dissect the wing, you will find a Fat main wing connected to the thinner swept wings, they blend pretty well.

![LcIH6LN.png](http://i.imgur.com/LcIH6LN.png)

![drO3BVb.png](http://i.imgur.com/drO3BVb.png)
